data.title: satire
data.text:
Quick Reference

The use of humour, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues. The word comes (in the early 16th century) from French, or from Latin satira, later form of satura ‘poetic medley’.

From: satire in The Oxford Dictionary of Phrase and Fable »
